intro: Cyphia aspergilloides var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed cyphia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are blue or violet in color. This variant is distinguished by its shorter stem compared to the typical form of Cyphia aspergilloides.
